basics.name: vmName
basics.label: Virtual machine name
basics.toolTip: Virtual machines in Azure have two distinct names: virtual machine name used as the Azure resource identifier, and in guest host name. When you create a VM in the portal, the same name is used for both the virtual machine name and the host name. The virtual machine name cannot be changed after the VM is created. You can change the host name when you log into the virtual machine.

constraints.validationMessage: Virtual machine name must be 1-15 characters long.

basics.name: vmSize
basics.label: VM size
basics.toolTip:
Select a VM size to support the workload that you want to run. The size that you choose then determines factors such as processing power, memory, and storage capacity. Azure offers a wide variety of sizes to support many types of uses. Azure charges an hourly price based on the VM's size and operating system.
[Learn more about Virtual Machine sizes](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=2079859)

basics.name: adminUsername
basics.label: Admin username
basics.toolTip: The administrator username for the VM

toolTip.password: The administrator password for the VM

elements.name: teamId
elements.label: Parsec Team ID
elements.toolTip: Team Computers are provisioned by using the Team ID and Team's Computer Key, which can be obtained from the Teams administrator panel, in the Team Computers section.

elements.name: teamKey
elements.label: Parsec Team Key
elements.toolTip: Team Computers are provisioned by using the Team ID and Team's Computer Key, which can be obtained from the Teams administrator panel, in the Team Computers section.

elements.name: host
elements.label: Host Name
elements.toolTip: The name of your computer. Leave blank to use the virtual machine hostname.

constraints.validationMessage: Host name must be 1-15 characters long.

elements.name: userEmail
elements.label: Parsec User Email
elements.toolTip: You can assign a computer to a user using their Parsec email. If the email does not match an existing team member the computer becomes reserved and once a user with a matching email joins the team the computer is automatically assigned to them. You can revoke reservations through the admin dashboard.

constraints.validationMessage: Please enter a valid email address.

elements.name: isGuestAccess
elements.label: Guest Access
elements.toolTip: Team Computers can be enabled for Guest Access. Once enabled the computer will show in the Guest Access tab for all admins and guest access coordinators.

toolTip.domainNameLabel: Must be unique within the Azure region you create the name in (across all subscriptions and all customers). Azure automatically registers the name and IP address in its DNS so you can connect to a resource with the name. Azure appends a default subnet location.cloudapp.azure.com to the name you provide to create the fully qualified DNS name.

toolTip.virtualNetwork: Virtual networks are logically isolated from each other in Azure. You can configure their IP address ranges, subnets, route tables, gateways, and security settings, much like a traditional network in your data center. Virtual machines in the same virtual network can access each other by default.
toolTip.subnets: The name must be unique within the virtual network. For maximum compatibility with other Azure services, we recommend using a letter as the first character of the name.

elements.name: tagsByResource
elements.toolTip: Tags are name/value pairs that enable you to categorize resources and view consolidated billing by applying the same tag to multiple resources and resource groups.
